featured.text: The additional tines made diners less likely to drop food, and the curved tines served as a scoop so people did not have to constantly switch to a spoon while eating.
In late 17th century France, larger forks with four curved tines were developed.
Curved windows, on the other hand, distribute stress around more evenly, reducing the likelihood of cracks or breaks.
Why were forks made into a curved shape?

definition.en_def: Having a shape that is not straight; bending or arching.
definition.example: The road ahead is curved, making it difficult to see what lies beyond.
